title: Twin Prime XOR Law: Computational Validation and Source Code
description: High-performance C++ implementation for computational validation of the Twin Prime XOR Identity theorem. Includes deterministic Miller-Rabin primality testing, OpenMP parallelization, and validation of 1+ billion twin prime pairs with p < 10^12. Achieves 100% verification rate with chi-squared statistic of 20.40 (p < 0.05), confirming geometric distribution P(k) = 2^(-k) for k-values derived from 2-adic valuations.
references: Hardy, G. H., & Wright, E. M. (2008). An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers (6th ed.). Oxford University Press.
Crandall, R., & Pomerance, C. (2005). Prime Numbers: A Computational Perspective (2nd ed.). Springer.
